item.title: John McAfee to Launch Giant Bitcoin Mining Operation in the U.S | Finance Magnates
item.description:
John McAfee to Launch Giant Bitcoin Mining Operation in the U.S | Finance Magnates

It is feared by many that the utter dominance of Bitcoin mining by a handful of Chinese firms will doom the cryptocurrency. However, despite the fact that international competitors such as KnCMiner were driven to bankruptcy, a new venture dares to take on China with a facility in the US no less.

item.title: Bitcooin BIP 75 Proposal Raises Debate: Security/Privacy vs Easy-To-Use Wallets
item.description:
Bitcooin BIP 75 Proposal Raises Debate: Security/Privacy vs Easy-To-Use Wallets

The BIP 75 proposal to improve bitcoin's ease of use has drawn a lot of criticism among bitcoiners on account of the option for a receiver to identify himself to the sender, according to an article by Bitcoin Magazine's Kyle Torpey disseminated by Nasdaq.

item.title: Pound Sterling Continues Downward Trend On Bank of England News
item.description:
Pound Sterling Continues Downward Trend On Bank of England News

All of this negative news for the Pound Sterling is not sending other currencies flying upwards in value either. The US Dollar is still weakening against the Euro and the Yen. This week has not been a good one for the Pound Sterling.

item.title: Ethereum Is Not a Government, It Is a DAO - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Ethereum Is Not a Government, It Is a DAO - Bitcoin News

Governance is the new buzz word of blockchain tech. And perhaps with good reason. But does this meant that blockchain systems are a new kind of Government? Also read: HashOcean: Another Cloud Mining Scam? In a recent LetsTalkBitcoin podcast with Andreas Antonopoulos, Pamela Morgan discussed the facts and challenges posed by the legendary DAO hack with Ethereum insider Taylor Gerring and Attorney Brian Klein.

item.title: Mexican Central Bank Raises Rates to Counter Peso Slump: Opportunity for Bitcoin
item.description:
Mexican Central Bank Raises Rates to Counter Peso Slump: Opportunity for Bitcoin

Facing a weakening peso, Mexico raised interest rates on Thursday. Banco de Mexico, the nation's central bank, raised its rate by half a percentage point to 4.25%, higher than projected. According to Jose Rodriguez, VP of Payments for cryptocurrency exchange Bitso, this is because the peso has fallen on hard times and is performing poorly against other currencies.

item.title: How a fear of inflation is driving bitcoin's popularity in China
item.description:
How a fear of inflation is driving bitcoin's popularity in China

Growing concerns about secrecy and the vulnerability of the global financial sector are forcing the general public to learn about bitcoin and associated technologies. Digital Gold: The Untold Story...

item.title: Industry research papers highlight blockchain technology's disruptive potential
item.description:
Industry research papers highlight blockchain technology's disruptive potential

The potential uses for blockchains in all of their various forms are piling up, and everywhere you turn another multinational corporation, industry organization, central bank, or government has come out with a research paper extolling the benefits of blockchains, distributed ledger technology, and even Bitcoin itself.

item.title: Walmart Pay Is Now Live In Over 30 US States
item.description:
Walmart Pay Is Now Live In Over 30 US States

The world of mobile payments is filled with different competitors these days. Walmart, one of the biggest brands in the US, has created their own payment solution. Walmart Pay, as this concept is called, is slowly expanding its reach across the US.

item.title: The Cobra-Bitcoin Mystery Needs To Be Solved
item.description:
The Cobra-Bitcoin Mystery Needs To Be Solved

In a story we covered yesterday, it became apparent that Cobra-Bitcoin is for releasing newer versions of the Satoshi Nakamoto Bitcoin whitepaper. However, many people assumed Cobra is a member of the BlockStream development team. While that is hard to confirm or deny at this stage, it appears there are some blurry lines when it comes to this person's identity.

item.title: Heifer International Now Accepts Bitcoin Donations Through BitPay - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Heifer International Now Accepts Bitcoin Donations Through BitPay - NEWSBTC

Heifer International, the leading US-based nonprofit organization will soon be accepting bitcoin donations from across the world. Read more... The non-profit industry is definitely warming up to the thought of adopting bitcoin as an additional channel for receiving donations. Heifer International, a 72-year-old nonprofit has become the latest one to join the ranks by tying up with BitPay.
